incidents.name: SMS Delivery Delays to Sudani Network in Sudan From Pre-Registered Sender ID

incident_updates.body: We are experiencing SMS delivery delays when sending messages to Sudani Network in Sudan from pre-registered Sender ID. Our engineers are working with our carrier partner to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

affected_components.name: CARRIER NETWORK - SMS, Middle East & Africa

incidents.name: SMS Delivery Delays to Multiple Networks in Armenia

incident_updates.body: We are no longer experiencing SMS delivery delays when sending messages to multiple networks in Armenia. This incident has been resolved.

We are observing recovery in SMS delivery delays when sending messages to multiple networks in Armenia. We will continue monitoring the service to ensure a full recovery. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are still experiencing SMS delivery delays when sending messages to multiple networks in Armenia. Our engineers are working with our carrier partner to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are experiencing SMS delivery delays when sending messages to multiple networks in Armenia. Our engineers are working with our carrier partner to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Customers Unable to Access Regional API Keys

incident_updates.body: The issue preventing customers from rotating auth tokens and accessing API keys has been resolved and the Australia and Ireland regions are operating normally at this time.

Our engineers are investigating issues with customers being unable to rotate their auth tokens and access their API keys for the Australia and Ireland regions. We expect to provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.
We've become aware of a potential issue with accessing regional API keys. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

incidents.name: Elevated Error Rate and Latency with Adyen Payment Processing

incident_updates.body: The issue causing elevated error rates and latency for customer integrations with Adyen <pay> platform has been resolved and the service is functioning normally at this time. Please refer here for more details - https://www.adyen.com/landing/platform-status.

Twilio has detected elevated error rate and latency for customer integrations with Adyen <pay> platform. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available. Customers are advised to use PayPal as a workaround. Please refer to https://www.adyen.com/landing/platform-status"

incidents.name: High Service Latency Issues for Customer Integrations with Adyen <pay> Platform

incident_updates.body: The issue causing high service latency for customer integrations with Adyen <pay> platform has been resolved and the service is functioning normally at this time. This incident has been resolved. Please refer here for more details - https://www.adyen.com/landing/platform-status.

Twilio has detected high service latency for customer integrations with Adyen <pay> platform . Customers may experience failures of payments via <Pay> and Pay Agent Assist due to an incident with Adyen. Please see their status page at https://status.adyen.com/

incidents.name: Issues With New Customers Changing Currency from USD

incident_updates.body: The issue with new customers not being able to change their currency settings away from USD currency, in Twilio Console has been resolved. Customers creating trial accounts can now change their default Currency away from USD.

We are investigating a potential issue with new customers being able to change their currency settings away from USD currency, in Twilio Console. Our engineering team is actively investigating. We expect to provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with new customers being able to change their currency settings away from USD currency, in Twilio Console. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

incidents.name: Delays in Voice Transcriptions with VoiceBase

incident_updates.body: Voice Transcriptions with VoiceBase were degraded for 27 minutes between 06:51 and 7:18 Pacific Time on 03/16/2022. During this period, customers may have experienced delayed transcriptions. The issue has now been resolved.

incidents.name: On Call Engineers are Investigating

incident_updates.body: We have fully investigated the Zipwhip issue triggered by our automated alert, and it was determined that there is no noticeable customer impact. All systems are operational.
Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with Zipwhip. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

incidents.name: Super SIM Network Connectivity Issues

incident_updates.body: Super SIM network connectivity issues have been resolved and is operating normally at this time.

[Since 06:15 UTC] We are investigating an issue affecting less than 5% of devices using Super SIM, which may result in delays when connecting to the network. Devices with an existing data connection are not impacted; however, they may experience delays if they attempt to re-establish the data connection. Our engineering team is actively collaborating with the affected network provider to resolve this issue. We will provide a further update within 2 hours or sooner, as more information becomes available.

[Since 06:15 UTC] We are investigating an issue affecting less than 5% of devices using Super SIM, which may result in delays when connecting to the network. Devices with an existing data connection are not impacted; however, they may experience delays if they attempt to re-establish the data connection. Our engineering team is actively collaborating with the affected network provider to resolve this issue. We will provide a further update within 1 hour or sooner, as more information becomes available.
We've become aware of a potential issue with Super SIM. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

incidents.name: Customers Invoice sections incorrectly refer to [ROOT PRICE]

incident_updates.body: Invoices issued for January 2023, for approximately 90,000 customers, included a “ROOT PRICING” text in some of the SKU Group grouping texts. This was unexpected and caused confusion for some customers, who were on a custom pricing plan and inferred they were not getting that plan. There was no impact to usage or invoicing values calculated, sent to customers or tracked through our systems, this was a presentation problem with SKU Group descriptions only.

incidents.name: On Call Engineers are Investigating

incident_updates.body: We have fully investigated the potential issue with console phone numbers 504s issue, and it was determined that the impact was limited to a small set of customers, who have been contacted individually to address any concerns. All systems are operational.

Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with console phone numbers 504s. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

incident_updates.body:
During the time period 2023-03-07 17:05:00 - 2023-03-07 18:35:00 UTC we observed an elevated rate of error code 60613 (Provider Degradation) for the Lookup Line Type Intelligence Package. All other Packages were working normally

The service is currently restored. This incident is retroactive
